title: How Netanyahu Prolonged the War in Gaza to Stay in Power
summary: Secret meetings, altered records, ignored intelligence: the inside story of the prime minister’s political calculations since Oct. 7.

title: Takeaways From the Times Investigation Into Benjamin Netanyahu
summary: Prolonging the Gaza war helped the Israeli prime minister forestall a political reckoning.

title: Netanyahu’s War
summary: We spoke to the Jerusalem bureau chief about his investigative profile about the Israeli prime minister.

title: How Netanyahu Prolonged the Gaza War, and the F.B.I.’s Loyalty Test
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Kerr County Repeatedly Sought Help with Flood Risk. Texas Said No.
summary: Kerr County failed to secure a warning system, even as local officials remained aware of the risks and as billions of dollars were available for similar projects.

title: Why the Texas Flood Site Didn’t Have Warning Sirens
summary: Officials in Kerr County made several attempts over the past decade to get funds for a flood warning system, but those applications were rejected. Christopher Flavelle, a reporter for The New York Times, breaks down what went wrong.

title: Trump’s Seesawing on Tariffs Gives the World Whiplash
summary: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will do next.

title: Behind Trump’s Decision to Tax Brazil to Save Bolsonaro
summary: Right-wing Brazilians wanted sanctions against the judge prosecuting Brazil’s former president. President Trump opted for something far bigger — tariffs.

title: Targeting Brazil, Trump Tests Legal Limit of His Tariff Powers
summary: The president signaled he would seek to use the threat of steep levies to reorient trade and protect his political allies.

title: The F.B.I. Is Using Polygraphs to Test Officials’ Loyalty
summary: Some senior officials who have taken the test have been asked whether they said anything negative about the F.B.I. director, Kash Patel.

title: Federal Agents Clash With Protesters During Immigration Raid at California Farm
summary: Officers appeared to use crowd control munitions and tear gas against protesters. The F.B.I. said it was searching for a person who appeared to fire a pistol at officers.

title: Justice Dept. Demands Private Patient Info From Trans Youth Medicine Providers
summary: Doctors and hospitals were subpoenaed for private information on gender-related care for minors, the latest move by the Trump administration to stop the treatments.

title: State Department to Soon Begin Mass Layoffs
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio’s plan to downsize a “bloated” department had been on hold after a court ruling.

title: Srebrenica, a Massacre Foretold, Still Casts Its Shadow
summary: The town was supposed to be a “safe area,” protected by U.N. peacekeepers, but Serb forces massacred 8,000 Muslim men and boys there.

title: After Trump’s SNAP Cuts, 300,000 in NYC Could Lose Food Benefits
summary: The president’s sweeping new law includes work requirements for more people and less coverage for some noncitizens. Republicans argue the cuts are needed to tackle waste and fraud.

title: Does Brooklyn Need a New Waterfront Neighborhood?
summary: The risks and opportunities of turning 122 industrial acres over to developers.

title: Nantucket’s Workers Are Living on the Margins
summary: Teachers, police officers, firefighters and other workers live in overcrowded and substandard housing, or even in their cars on the beach.

title: How James Gunn Modeled Superman’s Dog Krypto After His Own Pet
summary: For the furry sidekick, Krypto, in “Superman,” the director James Gunn found inspiration — and a physical model — in his own unruly pet.

title: Superman’s Other Secret Weakness? Journalism Ethics.
summary: Writing for The Daily Planet about his heroic alter ego raises thorny issues for Clark Kent. Lois Lane has her conflicts, too.

title: Another Day, Another Chatbot’s Nazi Meltdown
summary: The folks at X say don’t worry; they’re on it.

title: The Dollar’s in Trouble, but Not for the Reason You Think
summary: New payment systems allow users and banks to bypass the U.S. currency and sanctions.

title: Ronny Chieng Ponders Iran’s Threat to Kill a Sunbathing Trump
summary: The “Daily Show” host called the threat “an attack on all of America, because now we all have to picture him with his bare belly glistening in the sun.”

title: Kurdish PKK Fighters Burn Weapons in Step Toward Peace With Turkey
summary: The disarmament of the P.K.K., a group that has battled since the 1980s for Kurdish independence, could end a conflict that has killed more than 40,000 people.

title: Two Dozen Hospitalized in Mass Drug Overdose in Baltimore
summary: An unusually large number of overdoses sent crews searching alleys and homes for victims. Officials have not said what type of drug was involved.

title: At Least 13 People Died by Suicide Amid U.K. Post Office Scandal, Report Says
summary: A public inquiry into the wrongful prosecutions of about 1,000 postal workers has uncovered more victims than previously known, according to a report.

title: Livvy Dunne Tried to Buy Babe Ruth’s Former Apartment. An N.Y.C. Co-op Board Said ‘No’.
summary: The influencer and former collegiate gymnast tried to buy the Manhattan two-bedroom, but instead joined the ranks of high-profile rejects like Madonna and Calvin Klein.
